definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: When a process forks, the child's capability sets are copied from the parent.
sentences.chinese: 在产生进程时，子进程从父进程复制能力集。

sentences.english: Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
sentences.chinese: 愿恩惠平安，从父神和主耶稣基督，归与你们。

sentences.english: And so, my soul, thou art receiving a music lesson from thy Father.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我的己哪，你现在正在从父学习音乐功课。

definition: father and elder brother(s)/head of the family/patriarch
faithful (to the memory of betrothed)/constant (of widow who remains unmarried)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
to be orphaned of one's father
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
Zhangzi county in Shanxi 山西[Shan1 xi1]
